Children could play with household items: Children could find creative ways to play with everyday objects around the house, such as using cardboard boxes as forts or turning pots and pans into drums.
Nature-based play: Children could spend more time exploring the outdoors and engaging in nature-based activities like building forts, playing in the mud, or going on scavenger hunts.
Imaginary play: Children could use their imagination to create their own worlds and characters, playing games like make-believe or role-playing.
Arts and crafts: Children could channel their creativity through arts and crafts, like painting, drawing, or building things with materials like clay, paper, and glue.
Physical activities: Children could engage in physical activities like playing tag, jumping rope, or playing sports, which can help them stay active and healthy.
